item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, February 15, 2025 at 6:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Deepseek R1 Distill 8B Q40 on 4 x Raspberry Pi 5, 6.43 tok/s (eval 11.68 tok/s) (144 points | 52 comments)
2. Carbon capture more costly than switching to renewables, researchers find (187 points | 138 comments)

5. The 20 year old PSP can now connect to WPA2 WiFi Networks (340 points | 106 comments)
6. We were wrong about GPUs (703 points | 454 comments)

10. A decade later, a decade lost (2024) (466 points | 137 comments)
11. Darcs, Friendly Version Control (18 points | 5 comments)

14. Did Semgrep Just Get a Lot More Interesting? (142 points | 62 comments)

18. TL;DW: Too Long; Didn't Watch Distill YouTube Videos to the Relevant Information (185 points | 137 comments)
19. Nintendo Obtains New Anti-Palworld Patent and Seeks Even More (50 points | 42 comments)
20. If you ever stacked cups in gym class, blame my dad (270 points | 40 comments)
21. Complex dynamics require complex solutions (191 points | 125 comments)
22. Diablo hackers uncovered a speedrun scandal (87 points | 48 comments)
23. Recurring checklists using Org Mode in Emacs (61 points | 2 comments)
24. The Iconic 3DBenchy Enters the Public Domain (182 points | 19 comments)
25. Nping – ping, but with a graph or table view (100 points | 47 comments)
26. Increasing rat numbers in cities are linked to climate warming, urbanization (41 points | 20 comments)
27. Show HN: I Built a Reddit-style Bluesky client – still rough, but open to ideas (51 points | 14 comments)
28. Improved evaluation times with pre-resolved Nix store paths (29 points | 31 comments)
29. Bookshop.org launches Kindle alternative, sends e-book sales to local bookstores (184 points | 77 comments)
30. TeX and Typst: Layout Models (2024) (218 points | 35 comments)
